title: Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit | 25 Guided STEM Experiment Lessons | 48 Page Color Student Guide | Grades 3-6 | Ages 8+ | Play & Learn | Parents' Choice Silver Award Winner
descriptions:
Title: Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit | 25 STEM Experiments | Grades 3-6 | Ages 8+ | Play & Learn | Parents' Choice Silver Award Winner

Description: Learn how electricity powers motion with the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit. This kit allows you to explore the inner workings of an electric motor and generator through 25 guided STEM experiments. The motor, made of transparent plastic, gives you a clear view of its components in action. You can set it up to run on battery power and discover how it works, then reconfigure it as a hand-crank electric generator. Experiment with magnets to learn about magnetism and its relationship with electric current. Build simple circuits with the motor or generator, wires, and a light bulb to understand the flow of electricity. With its 48-page color student guide, this kit provides step-by-step instructions for each experiment. Perfect for children in grades 3-6, ages 8 and up.

Introducing the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit, a fun and educational toy that allows children to learn about the fascinating world of electricity and motion. With 25 guided STEM experiment lessons, this kit is perfect for children in grades 3-6, ages 8 and up. 

This science kit includes a transparent plastic electric motor, allowing kids to observe the inner workings and understand how it converts electricity into motion. They can also explore how an electric generator works by converting motion into electricity. 

With the included magnets, children can experiment and learn about the force of magnetism and its relationship with electric current. They can even build simple circuits with the motor or generator, wires, and a light bulb to understand the flow of electricity. 

The Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit comes with a 48-page color student guide, providing step-by-step instructions for each experiment. It has been recognized with the Parents' Choice Silver Award, ensuring its quality and educational value. 

Don't miss out on this award-winning science kit that combines play and learning. Order your Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit today and spark your child's curiosity in science and engineering!

Introducing the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit! This award-winning STEM kit is designed for grades 3-6 and ages 8+. With 25 guided experiment lessons, your child will learn how electric motors convert electricity into motion and how electric generators do the opposite, converting motion into electricity. 

The electric motor in this kit is made of transparent plastic, allowing your child to observe its inner workings. They can set it up to run on battery power and discover how it works. They can also reconfigure it to function as a hand-crank electric generator and learn about the force of magnetism through experiments with magnets. 

The kit includes a 48-page color student guide with step-by-step instructions, making it easy for your child to follow along. They can build simple circuits using the motor or generator, wires, and a light bulb to understand the flow of electricity. They will also explore gears and drive-trains, gaining a deeper understanding of how energy is converted.

This Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit is a fantastic educational tool that allows children to play and learn at the same time. It has been recognized with the Parents' Choice Silver Award, ensuring its quality and educational value. Don't miss out on this opportunity to inspire your child's curiosity and creativity. Get the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit today!

Introducing the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit! This award-winning STEM toy is perfect for kids ages 8 and up, offering 25 guided experiment lessons to learn about electric motors and generators. Watch as the transparent plastic motor reveals its inner workings, demonstrating how electricity is converted into motion. Explore further by reconfiguring the device to work as a hand-crank electric generator. Experiment with magnets and learn about the force of magnetism and its relation to electric current. The kit includes a 48-page color student guide to provide step-by-step instructions for each experiment. Don't miss out on this educational and engaging play and learn experience!

Explore the fascinating world of motors and generators with the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit! This kit includes 25 guided STEM experiment lessons, a 48-page color student guide, and has won the Parents' Choice Silver Award. 

Learn how an electric motor converts electricity into motion and discover how an electric generator does the opposite, converting motion into electricity. The transparent plastic motor allows you to observe its inner workings, providing a hands-on learning experience. 

Experiment with magnets to understand the force of magnetism and how it relates to electric current. Build simple circuits to learn about the flow of electricity and explore gears and drive-trains to understand how they convert kinetic energy into electrical energy. 

This kit is perfect for children in grades 3-6, ages 8 and up. It includes a 60-page full-color manual with step-by-step instructions for each experiment. 

Don't miss out on this engaging and educational play and learn experience. Get the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit today!

Introducing the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit, a captivating STEM learning experience for children ages 8 and up. This award-winning kit includes 25 guided experiment lessons that allow kids to explore the fascinating world of electric motors and generators. With a transparent plastic motor, children can observe the inner workings and learn how electricity is converted into motion. They can also reconfigure the device to work as a hand-crank electric generator, understanding how motion can be converted into electricity. Experimenting with magnets helps kids discover the force of magnetism and its relation to electric current. The kit also includes a 48-page color student guide with step-by-step instructions, making it easy for children to play and learn. Don't miss out on this Parents' Choice Silver Award winner that brings science to life!

Introducing the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit! This award-winning kit is designed to provide an engaging and educational experience for children in grades 3-6 (ages 8+). The electric motor in this kit is made of transparent plastic, allowing children to observe its inner workings and understand how it functions. They can set up the motor to run on battery power and learn how it works, and then reconfigure it to work in reverse as a hand-crank electric generator. 

The kit also includes experiments with magnets, teaching children about the force of magnetism and how magnetic fields relate to electric current. By building simple circuits with the motor or generator, wires, and a light bulb, children can learn about the flow of electricity. 

With a comprehensive 48-page color student guide, this kit provides step-by-step instructions for each experiment, ensuring a seamless learning experience. 

Don't miss out on this Parents' Choice Silver Award-winning science kit that combines play and learning! Get the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit today and watch your child's curiosity and knowledge soar!

Introducing the Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit! This award-winning kit is perfect for kids in grades 3-6 who are eager to learn about the wonders of electricity and motion. With 25 guided STEM experiment lessons and a 48-page color student guide, this kit provides an engaging and educational experience.

Discover how an electric motor converts electricity into motion and explore the inner workings of the motor through its transparent plastic. With the ability to set up the motor to run on battery power, children can see firsthand how a motor works. They can then reconfigure the device to work in reverse as a hand-crank electric generator, learning how motion can be converted into electricity.

This kit also allows children to experiment with magnets, teaching them about the force of magnetism and how magnetic fields relate to electric current. By building simple circuits consisting of the motor or generator, wires, and a light bulb, they can learn about the flow of electricity. Additionally, they will gain a deeper understanding of gears and drive-trains and how they effectively convert kinetic energy into electrical energy and back again.

With a 60-page full-color manual, this new 2012 item provides clear and concise instructions for each experiment. The Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit is the perfect combination of play and learning, making it a must-have for children ages 8 and up. Don't miss out on this Parents' Choice Silver Award winner - get yours today!

Children can also experiment with magnets to discover the force of magnetism and its relationship to electric current. By building simple circuits with the motor or generator, wires, and a light bulb, they can learn about the flow of electricity.

Through experiments with magnets, children will learn about the force of magnetism and how magnetic fields relate to electric current. They can also build simple circuits with the motor or generator, wires, and a light bulb to understand the flow of electricity.

Write an advertising description for the following product. Use the existing description below as a guideline, matching it roughly in quality and level of detail. Do not include information not available in the description below. Do not directly plagiarize the description below. Be concise and informative. Assume potential buyers who read the ad have access to a photo of the product, and are scanning through many different similar advertisements, spending little time on each, and that they value being able to quickly see the most important details.

---

Title: Thames & Kosmos Motors & Generators Science Kit | 25 Guided STEM Experiment Lessons | 48 Page Color Student Guide | Grades 3-6 | Ages 8+ | Play & Learn | Parents' Choice Silver Award Winner

Description: Learn how an electric motor converts electricity into motion

Explore how an electric generator converts motion into electricity

Observe the motor's inner working through its transparent plastic

Discover how magnetic fields relate to electric current

New 2012 item - includes 60-page full-color manual

Product Description   665036 features: -Electric motor is made of transparent plastic to show the inside components. -Set up the motor to run on battery power and learn how a motor works. -Reconfigure the device to work in reverse as a hand-crank electric generator. -Experiment with magnets to learn about the force of magnetism. Category: -electronic learning. Minimum age requirement: -8 years and up. Dimensions: overall height - top to bottom: -13. 1 inches. Overall Width - side to side: -8. 9 inches. Overall depth - front to back: -2. 6 inches. Overall product weight: -1. 3 pounds.   From the Manufacturer   Electric motors and generators are in countless devices, appliances, and vehicles we use every day. They are an essential technology in our modern world. With this kit, you can conduct 25 experiments to learn how an electric motor converts electricity into motion, and how an electric generator does just the opposite, converting motion into electricity. The electric motor is made of transparent plastic to show how the inside components work. Set up the motor to run on battery power and learn how a motor works. Then reconfigure the device to work in reverse as a hand-crank electric generator. Experiment with magnets to learn about the force of magnetism, and how magnetic fields relate to electric current. Build simple circuits consisting of the motor or generator, wires, and a light bulb to learn about the flow of electricity. Learn about gears and drive-trains and how they work to effectively convert kinetic energy into electrical energy and back again. The full-color, 48-page manual guides your experiments with step-by-step instructions.
